snippet: There are good reasons to be skeptical of predictions of doctor shortages in 10 years.
abstract: Ezekiel J Emanuel and Scott Gottlieb Op-Ed article contends a shortage of physicians is unlikely to occur due to the health care reform law; maintains more important problem will be increasing the productivity of existing physicians and other health care workers while incorporating new technologies and practices.

byline.original: By SCOTT GOTTLIEB and EZEKIEL J. EMANUEL

lead_paragraph: There are good reasons to be skeptical of predictions of doctor shortages in 10 years.

headline.main: No, There Won’t Be a Doctor Shortage
headline.print_headline: No, There Won’t Be a Doctor Shortage

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
